required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of a Once-daily Dose of Tigecycline vs Ertapenem in Diabetic Foot Infections (DFI) With a Substudy in Patients With Diabetic Foot Infections Complicated by Osteomyelitis.
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Comparison Study of the Safety and Efficacy of a Once-Daily Dose of Tigecycline Versus Ertapenem for the Treatment of Foot Infections in Subjects With Diabetes

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to look at the safety and effectiveness of a once-daily dose of tigecycline compared to ertapenem for the treatment of diabetic foot infections. The co-primary efficacy endpoints were not met.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Clinical Response of Cure Vs. Failure.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Test of cure visit (TOC): Assessed at least 12 days post last dose
primary_outcome.description: Cure: Recovery so no added antibiotic therapy. Failure: Added antibiotic therapy for no response or worsening after improvement, new purulence, >120% doses, non-routine surgical treatment or death related to Diabetic Foot Infections (DFI) > 48 hrs.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Clinical Response of Cure Vs. Failure/Indeterminate.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Test of cure visit (TOC): Assessed at least 12 days post last dose
primary_outcome.description: Cure: Recovery so no added antibiotic therapy. Failure: Added antibiotic therapy for no response or worsening after improvement, new purulence, >120% doses, non-routine surgical treatment or death related to DFI > 48 hrs. Indeterminate: Lost to follow-up, death<48 hours or noninfection related.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Clinical Response of Cure Vs. Failure Assessed at Least 25 - 27 Weeks Post Last Dose.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Test of cure visit (TOC): Assessed at least 25 - 27 weeks post last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Cure: Recovery so no added antibiotic therapy. Failure: Added antibiotic therapy for no response or worsening after improvement, new purulence, >120% doses, non-routine surgical treatment or death related to DFI > 48 hrs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Clinical Response of Cure Vs. Failure/Indeterminate Assessed at Least 25 - 27 Weeks Post Last Dose.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Test of cure visit (TOC): Assessed at least 25 - 27 weeks post last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Cure: Recovery so no added antibiotic therapy. Failure: Added antibiotic therapy for no response or worsening after improvement, new purulence, >120% doses, non-routine surgical treatment or death related to DFI > 48 hrs. Indeterminate: Lost to follow-up, death<48 hours or noninfection related.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Microbiologic Response of Eradication.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Test of cure visit (TOC): Assessed at least 12 days post last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Eradication defined as: no pathogen is present in the repeat culture from the original site of infection, or a clinical response of the cure precludes the availability of a specimen for culture.

intervention.description: 150 mg Tigecycline once-daily IV infusion for up to 28 days, or 42 days for the substudy wth osteomyelitis

Ertapenem 1g IV infusion every 24 hours +/- vancomycin depending on culture results and at the discretion of investigator (for coverage of Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA), coagulase-negative staphylococci (CNS) or enterococci coverage).

criteria.textblock:
Main inclusion criteria:
- Men and women aged 18 or older with diabetes and a qualifying foot infection. People with evidence of a diabetic foot infection with osteomyelitis may qualify for the osteomyelitis substudy arm.
Main exclusion criteria:
- People with additional significant disease, infection with resistant pathogens, contraindication, or hypersensitivity to any test article or related antibiotic.

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

responsible_party.name_title: Wyeth (Registry Contact: Clinical Trial Registry Specialist)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited worldwide from January 2007 to February 2009.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients were screened for up to 24 hours.

group.title: Tigecycline
group.description: Tigecycline 150 mg IV infusion every 24 hours

group.title: Ertapenem
group.description: Ertapenem 1g IV infusion every 24 hours +/- vancomycin depending on culture results and at the discretion of investigator (for coverage of Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA), coagulase-negative staphylococci (CNS) or enterococci coverage).

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Statistical analysis tested for non-inferiority. Non-inferiority margin is -10%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Adjusted for Perfusion, Extent, Depth/tissue loss, Infection, and Sensation (PEDIS) score

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PIs agreed to allow the sponsor 60 days to review and require changes to presentations or publications but only to protect confidential information and intellectual property, and for the sponsor to file a patent application, as applicable. The PIs also agreed for data to be presented first as a joint, multi-center publication.
